intro: Sonchus heterophyllus, commonly known as the variable sowthistle, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and has alternate, lobed or entire leaves that vary in shape depending on the growth conditions. The plant produces yellow composite flowers, which are followed by spherical, spiky seed heads. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Due to its rapid growth and adaptability, it is considered a weed in many regions.
